intro: Baccharis santiagensis, commonly known as the São Paulo baccharis, is a shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as campos and restingas. It has a woody stem and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
